reviews.title: Great beds, friendly staff, awful food, and expensive internet
reviews.text: The hotel staff was professional and friendly, and the beds were incredible. However, the food served at my conference was awful, and I was terribly displeased to be in Seattle, surrounded by many hotels, and needing to pay for internet access through the Hilton. I will stay at any of the other hotels with free access next time I need to fly/be at a conference. And, if you do end up paying for internet in hourly increments, you must use them contingously, which is not practical for conference goers.
Stayed three nights in May 07 for business booked on Priceline for $55 a night.
reviews.title: Above Average comfort

likes.disliked: — High fees for parking and internet access

reviews.title: Surprisingly nice for an airport layover
reviews.text: Bigger room than I had before, very comfortable. Beds are wonderful. Hotel seemed half empty so wasn't noisy at all. Very limited plane or street noise.

I really only have two complaints about this hotel. The parking is outrageous at $18 a night, the garage is miles from the front desk and most of the rooms and the fact that they charge a high fee for internet access even if you have your own laptop. I've stayed at much cheaper hotels, even hotels in the Hilton family that offer free Internet access and use of a computer if you don't have one.
reviews.title: Security Improved

reviews.text: We had an overnight layover and selected this site based on other travelers' comments. It's not the Ritz but it is quite pleasant and the service is excellent. The complex is spacious, nice for getting some breathing room after a long flight. The dining room is expensive but the food was of excellent quality and preparation. There is a well-equipped and decent sized workout room and if the weather is cooperative a large, landscaped outdoor pool. The airport shuttle is on demand and only takes a few minutes between points.
reviews.title: Pretty good at Priceline rate of $65 plus $17 in taxes/fees (not worth $200)
Slipping
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel for years as business has taken me to Seattle. I used to love it, and I am sorry to report that the hotel is slipping in quality. By no means was my experience awful, but by no means was it anything approaching exceptional.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's start with the meal. The hotel's restaurant is an expensive steakhouse, Spencer's. I find that a bit annoying -- this is an airport hotel, and sometimes after a long flight, or with an early flight the next morning, what you would like is a tasty, but reasonably priced, meal, and a menu with some variety. Spencer's offers neither of those things -- the menu is very limited, and it is VERY expensive.
reviews.title: Easy in and out

reviews.text: On this trip, however, I was sort of craving a steak dinner -- it'd be a long couple of days of meals, I'd eaten like a rabbit, etc. So, I was prepared to splurge a bit on a meal. My experience at the restaurant was horrible. For one person -- who only ordered a salad, a steak, and a glass of wine -- the meal took 2 hours because of the horribly slow, unresponsive service, and it cost $80.00. Just.awful.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel 5 Mins from Airport

reviews.text: The hotel itself was under-staffed. The wait for check-in was long, because only a couple of agents were working. Room assignments were odd--as a Diamond Hilton HHonors member, I was "upgraded" to a room in the hotel's ancient, 2-story wing, which is a loooong walk from the lobby. I don't think a room on the second floor of a 2-story ancient wing counts as much of an 'upgrade.' When I asked for a room in that wing that would, at least, have a patio on the interior courtyard, I did receive it -- which belies the 'upgrade' language the agent originally tried to sell me on. The keys I was originally provided did not work -- after the long walk to the room -- so I got the pleasure of returning for a new set of keys.
reviews.title: Quiet

reviews.text: The room itself was fine -- spacious, comfortable bedding, clean -- but nothing overly fancy. The bathroom was very small, with an especially minature-ish tub. The hallways could use renovation. The hotel's fitness center was excellent.
reviews.title: average property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I thought this hotel was a disappointment due to the quality of the bathroom and the noise from the other guests and housekeeping. The extra charges can add up quickly too...
reviews.title: Long walks, huge room, grotty bathroom, noisy housekeeping...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was quick and the public areas of the hotel offer a good first impression. There is a bar and restaurant in the main lobby. Rooms look over a courtyard or the pool area - its a strange layout as there are also some rooms (starting at the 11s) which are opposite the ground floor conference rooms and are along the corridor to the pool, car park and conference centre - these must be very noisy so would try to avoid these
reviews.title: Nice hotel with good post-cruise location
A little bit of luxury and a gorgeous outdoor pool
reviews.text: Our room was 2209 - a double king - which was apparently an upgrade, It was huge with acres of space. Which made the fact that it had TINY bathroom really odd. The bathroom ceiling was 6 inches lower that the rest of the room and it didn't have a proper door - it was a sliding opaque glass door which didn't cover the door frame and offered little privacy. The WC was set at an angle, there was hardly any vanity top area and the bottom of the bath tub needed a good scrub - as did the mould around the shower. Yuk. The shower was so low on the wall I had to crouch down to wash my hair - my OH at 6ft found it harder to manage. Simply not good enough for a Hilton...

As is usual with hotels which have long corridors - people walk down them all hours of the night talking loudly to their acquaintances as did the housekeeping each morning and despite the Do Not Distrub sign hanging on the door, they happily stood chatting and vacuuming right outside our door at 8.00am. It felt like they wanted you out of the room asap...
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was provided via vouchers as my OH is a HHonors Gold - this was a continental buffet which is normally $16 and it was mediocre at best. You could upgrade to a cooked breakfast for a further $4 which we did on one morning but not on the next as it wasn't that good.
reviews.title: Nice hotel right by airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arranged for an double king room, which was nice, but the bathroom was too small and the water pressure low. The music from the room above us played their music loud. Had to call the front desk three times and they finally shut it down at 10:30pm PST. We had an early morning flight and had to get to sleep early. Shuttle van was nice and helpful. Great location.
reviews.title: Pleasant Room, loud neighbors

reviews.text: We booked this hotel because of the park and cruise package. It included a one night stay, 8 nights parking and shuttle transportation to and from the cruise port. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. The kids really enjoyed the pool area. The proximity to the light rail system was convenient (it was about a 40 minute trip to pike place market).The only negative was the shuttle company was a little disorganized on the return trip. I would definitely book this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great park and cruise package

reviews.text: Was hesitant about staying out so far from downtown, but couldn't find anything closer. Sure glad of that. The light rail is right across the street. Don't need to rent a car. Very convenient if you don't mind walking a bit once you get downtown Seattle. It's pricey but the food is excellent in the restaurant. We opted for the bed & breakfast and were pleased with it.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I stayed here on a short overnight layover at SEA airport at the beginning of August. The hotel was very easy to get to from the airport via the complimentary shuttle. After we got on the shuttle and started heading to the hotel, we realized that we likely could have simply *walked* to the hotel, ha! We arrived around 1am and were gone by 8am, so it was a short night.
reviews.title: Nice Hilton property, very close to the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very nice. Nothing incredible, but exactly what you would expect from a Hilton hotel. We got a good night's sleep, and used the shuttle to catch our morning flight.
reviews.title: Great value and very comfortable room

reviews.text: I was the meeting coordinator for a 2 day meeting in the conference center, and stayed in the hotel. They upgraded me to a king room on the first floor with a patio because of my conference duties. The room was clean and comfortable, although the rates seem quite high. Even though it is across the street from the airport, I did not hear any airport noise and the room was very quiet. Did not eat at Spencer's Restaurant in the hotel because it is so expensive and has a very limited menu. But splurged for room service for soup and salad one evening, which was good and served quickly. Parking garage is large, and located directly under the conference center, but is a long walk to the hotel, especially when dragging luggage and meeting supplies. The meeting facilities are nice, but is a very long walk to the conference center if you are staying in the hotel. The conference center banquet food and service were great. They meet all of our needs during the conference.
reviews.title: Stayed here for a 2 day meeting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Up to Hilton standards which I find are exceptional. The hotel is a short walk to light rail which I recommend you take if going to any downtown Seattle attractions since parking downtown is difficult and expensive. Also, close to airport. My only complaint would be the $20 parking fee and the long walk from the garage. Otherwise the location and hotel are perfect!
reviews.title: Convenient to light rail and airport

reviews.text: This hotel looks fine on the outside. Room assigned to us was spacious but it had very thin walls and floors. You hear the boom boom and the cracking on the ceiling everytime someone walks above your room. We could also hear the talking and TV sounds from the room next to ours. I had a bad sleep here and it was truly sleepless in Seattle.
reviews.title: Sleepless in Seattle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room also had a horrible smell like some musty/mold clothing. Toilet clogged and will only flush properly if you try for 6 times or so. The wall vent in the bathroom was very dirty. It was full with dust and dirt, just disgusting looking at it. Because it is located just a little bit above the eyesight it is very obvious and you see it every time you are in the bathroom. The location of the vent is low enough for accessed so it is something that can easily been cleaned by housekeeping staff and yet it looked like it has not been cleaned in months, if not years !
reviews.title: Good and convenient hotel

reviews.text: This is just not what you would expect from a Hilton hotel.
reviews.title: Very close to aiport and rail

reviews.text: Used Priceline and got 2 rooms for $55 each. Called the hotel two days before we arrived and asked for connecting rooms for our family. Got a King room and 2 Queens connecting. Very clean rooms, but on the noisier freeway side. No problems sleeping though, the beds were so comfortable- down quilts too!
reviews.title: Ups and Downs at the Hilton

likes.disliked: — Series of problems with pool, elevators, hot tub

reviews.title: Surprising-very nice.
reviews.text: Some problems/concerns-$18 parking, pool locked and needed two calls to security to get it unlocked, hot tub cold with no jets,one elevator out of order for more than 24 hours. Some very helpful and respectful front desk people. Wouldn't stay here at the rack rate but for $55 it was fantastic.

Surprising-great experience. Checked in at 2:00 with my family and spent the night in comfy down covered beds. Comfy, Comfy. Hotel is bright as a penny and very clean. I based ny choice on a previous positive review and I agree-I would stay here again hands down.
reviews.title: Upcharges everywhere, $$ Parking charge is ridiculous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Priceline $58/night and it seemed like a great deal. We did not expect all the upcharges being so far away from downtown. $16 parking was extremely excessive especially when this is a location where land is abundent and cheap. I've paid less in downtown Seattle. $9.95 Internet chage is expected at a full-service hotel, but this hotel did not seem to be full-service. Pool and hot tub were out of service. Nothing is convenient, you have to drive far for good restaurants and amenities.
reviews.title: $$ Parking Surprise

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Frustrating and overpriced

likes.disliked: — getting to room, internet charges, lines at check-in / out

reviews.text: Prepaid rate on hilton.com $84 a night. Excellent rate for 2 people 2 beds.
reviews.title: great airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Hilton at the Seattle Airport four times, and each has been a very pleasureable experience. The rooms are big, the beds comfy, and the staff is pleasant. They have free coffee in room, dryer, iron/board, and in room PPV movies. The drawbacks are: $18/nt self park and very expensive bar/restaurant. I solidly recommend this hotel to anyone with business south of downtown Seattle.
reviews.title: Nifty hotel near Sea Tac airport

likes.disliked: — Expensive food & drink, high parking charges

reviews.text: This hotel is not only conveniently located, it is also clean and very comfortable. I stayed for two nights for work. I checked in early and got a room facing the airport. Initially, I was concerned about the noise, but I didn't hear a thing all night or even in the morning. Also, the bathroom is updated, clean and actually quite large. Parking was a bit expensive at $18 a day, but it was a nice parking facility that was easy to get to through the conference area. My only 2 complaints are that they charge for internet use in the business center and that the pillows were slightly musty. It may have been the result of a humid day or two because otherwise, the place was very clean. I had breakfast at Spencers and really enjoyed the breakfast buffet. For $15.00 it was certainly worth it. The concierge was very helpful and one gentleman with a beard offered the best advice in terms of downtown parking and attractions. He was kind enough to steer me away from tourist traps as well. A younger fellow was not as helpful and I ended up spending quite a bit for parking. Had I talked to this other gentleman first, I would have saved a bundle. However, everyone at the hotel was kind, professional and very very welcoming. There was super easy access to downtown Seattle from the hotel. I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Booked this room through Priceline for July 2007 stay for about $66 including taxes. The parking price noted in other reviews is true to a point. It is now either $18 for self park or $22 for valet parking. I currently live in a very large city and was shocked by the parking fee. The pay per WiFi is pretty pathetic. Don't touch the Fiji water in the room. It is $4.00.
reviews.title: Basic Hilton - Upcharges Everywhere
no free wi-fi
reviews.text: I realize that I paid a small fee for the room, but I did not expect Hilton to take it (I was hoping for a Courtyard by Marriott or something similar). They did not have to accept my price, but they did. And what they provided was pretty substandard for a Hilton. I don't think I have ever stayed in a smaller room. The beds were very comfortable, though.

reviews.title: The best
reviews.text: Nice set-up. Walk to the airport. Bid $60 on Priceline for stay in mid-July. Much less than $224 on Hilton website.
